thread.title: The Doctor Who opening theme got turned up to eleven for 'Before The Flood' - Doctor Who Cult
thread.title_full: The Doctor Who opening theme got turned up to eleven for 'Before The Flood' - Doctor Who News - Cult - Digital Spy

author: Megan Davies
title: The Doctor Who opening theme got turned up to eleven for 'Before The Flood' - Doctor Who Cult
text: We already know that the Twelfth Doctor isn't opposed to a guitar riff or two but now Doctor Who's very recognisable opening theme music has received a rock makeover of its own.Series composer Murray Gold put together the new arrangement for Saturday night's (October 10) episode 'Before The Flood', which saw Peter Capaldi's Doctor lead into the opening credits with help from Beethoven's 5th symphony.Doctor Who review: Before the Flood is scary and smartThe opening of 'Before the Flood' saw the Twelfth Doctor discussing the 'bootstrap paradox' ("Google it") using Ludwig van Beethoven as an example - a time traveller who loves Beethoven travels back in time to meet his hero, only to find out Beethoven doesn't exist so the time traveller decides to write out Beethoven's music and get it published.This then begs the question: Who really wrote Beethoven's music to begin with? © BBC During the explanation, the Doctor puts on his guitar on and plays the famous 'fate knocking at the door' theme from Beethoven's 5th as Gold's new, rock-inspired arrangement of the opening credits kick in.Capaldi himself is widely-rumoured to have provided the electric guitar over the top of the credits and fans have already taken to Twitter to mark this version of the theme tune as their favourite so far:I request every episode to begin with Peter Capaldi playing the theme on guitar. #DoctorWho— Toby (@Tobiiiaaas) October 10, 2015PETER. CAPALDI. PLAYING. THE. ELECTRIC. GUITAR. IS. ELECTRIC.— Victoria brown//39 (@Vicbrownie16) October 10, 2015Petition to include Peter Capaldi's guitar shredding in the usual mix of the sig tune. #DoctorWho— Jonathan Rothwell (@jrothwell) October 10, 2015So now we just have two questions that need answering: Will Capaldi be showing off his guitar skills again this season? And who knew the Doctor was such a fan of Beethoven?Find out what we thought of the latest episode in our video verdict: function onTemplateLoaded(experienceID) { bcExp = brightcove.getExperience(experienceID); modVP = bcExp.getModule(APIModules.VIDEO_PLAYER); modExp = bcExp.getModule(APIModules.EXPERIENCE); modCon = bcExp.getModule(APIModules.CONTENT); modVP.addEventListener(BCMediaEvent.BEGIN, onVideoStart); modVP.addEventListener(BCMediaEvent.STOP, onVideoStop); modVP.addEventListener(BCMediaEvent.PROGRESS, onVideoProgress); } #_containermyExperience4546229570001 { height: 100%; } // InSkin integration parameters: InSkinParams['myInSkin14546229570001'] = { 'srv_SectionID': '', 'srv_SectionIDPlay': '123757', 'srv_Keywords': '', 'plr_ContentID': 'myExperience4546229570001', 'plr_ContentType': 'BRIGHTCOVE3', 'plr_ContentW': 558, 'plr_ContentH': 314, 'plr_NoSkinContentResize': true, 'plr_NoSkinContentW': 618, 'plr_NoSkinContentH': 348, 'plr_NoSkinInSkinResize': true, 'plr_NoSkinInSkinW': 618, 'plr_NoSkinInSkinH': 348, 'plr_ResizeOnHideSkin': true, 'plr_HideSkinOnExternalAd': 'all', 'plr_ShowSkinAfterExternalAd': true, 'cnt_SmartPlayer': true }; // create the InSkin object: var InSkinObject4546229570001 = new InSkin.Base('myInSkin14546229570001'); brightcove.createExperiences(); if (!navigator.userAgent.match(/Android/i)) { InSkinObject4546229570001.init(); ai_type="video"; }
